ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Out of Memory Error
ygData.msgSnippet: My suggestion remains to run with a smaller heap. You had mentioned you were running with a 3GB heap. This part of the progress-statistics shows you re nowhere

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=q8Ciu1d7A6PqrdZa5t9rCmvBXHDZuYZSos2mI12sg5VW
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

My suggestion remains to run with a smaller heap.

You had mentioned you were running with a 3GB heap. This part of the 
progress-statistics shows you're nowhere near using that up:

mem-use-KB heap-size-KB
1623524 1642048

Together with the OutOfMemoryError without a "Java heap size" message, 
this indicates the problem is not in Java object-space, but some native 
resource or memory pool. Such problems can be made worse by a large 
heap, because that leaves less memory for other JVM activity.

I don't recall seeing how many threads you're running with, but each 
thread does require more non-heap memory -- especially if you've 
increased the per-thread stack size (-Xss) for any reason. So if you're 
using a lot of threads, reducing the number (or the -Xss value) might 
also help. (From the single progress-statistics.log line you've 
forwarded, the crawler does not look busy.)

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
